Issues.Title: Make it possible to opt out of making components standalone by default in Angular 19
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

We use Angular in a live coding service that runs solutions + tests from live coding questions on a recruitment testing website. With components becoming standalone by default in Angular 19, we have to update all the questions, which is not practical with the number of questions and we can't use the migration tool which updates components in normal projects.



### Proposed solution

It would be nice to have the option to opt out of standalone components by default on the project level. This will give us the ability to use the latest Angular version and update the questions over time.

### Alternatives considered

For our use case, the alternative is to update all the content on the website to use standalone explicitely while still using Angular 18, then release the upgrade to Angular 19. This option would require too much time.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Make it possible to opt out of making components standalone by default in Angular 19" (#61586)

Issues.Title: @let Directive should support object destructuring syntax in Angular templates
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request? core ### Description The @let directive is a powerful feature for working with signals in Angular templates. However, it currently lacks support for object destructuring, which limits its expressiveness and readability when dealing with structured data returned from signals or computed values. For example, given a signal: ```ts readonly stateSignal = signal({ keyA: 'foo', keyB: 'bar' }); ``` You must currently access the properties manually: ```html @let state = stateSignal();
{{ state.keyA }}
{{ state.keyB }}
``` This works but becomes verbose and less declarative. Support for destructuring would allow for a more concise and intuitive syntax: ```html @let { keyA, keyB } = stateSignal();
{{ keyA }}
{{ keyB }}
``` ### Proposed solution Extend the @let directive parsing to support object destructuring using JavaScript/TypeScript syntax: - Allow { ... } object pattern matching - Optionally allow renaming with keyA: aliasA - Support destructuring for both plain signals and computed values This would align template syntax more closely with TypeScript and reduce verbosity. ### Alternatives considered - Multiple let's - Multiple computeds
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "@let Directive should support object destructuring syntax in Angular templates" (#61590)

Issues.Title: refactor(common): drop promise and subscribable strategies
Issues.Body:
Adds `__PURE__` annotations to async pipe strategy expressions to enable tree-shaking, even if they are not referenced. These variables are not dropped when Angular is imported from a module that has `sideEffects` set to `true`.

### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request? compiler ### Description It works : ```html @let widthPx = `${width}px`;
``` ```html
``` It doesn't work : ```html
``` With this error message : ``Parser Error: Missing expected } at the end of the expression [{ width: `${width}px` }]`` I wrote an angular-eslint rule [prefer-template-literal](https://github.com/angular-eslint/angular-eslint/blob/main/packages/eslint-plugin-template/docs/rules/prefer-template-literal.md) to force writing in template literal but this limitation is very annoying because it applies the [wrong fixes](https://github.com/angular-eslint/angular-eslint/issues/2436). ### Proposed solution ```html
``` ### Alternatives considered I could try to detect the special case in the lint rule to using `@let` but that would be really annoying

#### Deprecations

##### platform-browser

-   All entries of the `@angular/platform-browser-dynamic`

#### Breaking Changes

##### core

-   `Resource.value()` now returns a default value when in a loading state after reloading the error state
-   `Resource.value()` now throws an error when it's in an error state. Previously it returned `undefined`.

-   `Resource.reload` has been moved to `WritableResource.reload`.

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/build): include full metadata for AOT unit-testing
Issues.Body:
Include class metadata and JIT information in code built for development and/or test usage. All non-optimized builds will now contain this metadata (`optimization.scripts` is false). The Angular TestBed APIs require additional metadata for the Angular aspects of the application such as Components, Modules, Pipes, etc.
TestBed may also leverage JIT capabilities during testing (e.g., `overrideComponent`). To support all these TestBed usage scenarios both the underlying `setClassMetadata` and `setNgModuleScope` class augmentation functions are now emitted when test metadata inclusion is enabled.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/build): include full metadata for AOT unit-testing" (#30366)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular/build): use new HMR documentation URL for console message
Issues.Body: The https://angular.dev/hmr URL is now used in the HMR enabled console message for the development server. The message text has also been shortened as the information is available at the aforementioned documentation location.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(@angular/build): use new HMR documentation URL for console message" (#30365)

Issues.Title: HMR doesn't work with `"aot": false`
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When angular.json is configured with `"aot": false`, HMR doesn't work at all.

### Minimal Reproduction

1. Create a project with `ng new`
2. In angular.json, add `"aot": false` to the build options (i.e `projects > project > architect > build > options`
3. Run `ng serve`
4. In the browser, open the dev tools & network tab
5. Make a change in any file, e.g the component HTML, TS, or CSS
6. Notice that the browser does a full refresh

### Exception or Error

```text

```

                |___/

### Anything else relevant?

Issue can be reproduced regardless of browser and OS.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "HMR doesn't work with `"aot": false`" (#30352)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/build): HMR requires AOT do not show HMR enabled when using JIT
Issues.Body: Currently, the HMR (Hot Module Replacement) functionality in `@angular/build` requires AOT compilation to be enabled. However, when using JIT compilation, a message indicating that HMR is enabled is incorrectly displayed.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/build): HMR requires AOT do not show HMR enabled when using JIT" (#30362)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular/build): check that AOT is enabled in HMR logic
Issues.Body: This commit refactors the HMR logic within `@angular/build` to explicitly check for AOT.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular/build): check that AOT is enabled in HMR logic" (#30363)

Issues.Title: Angular v19 - responsive prerendering for differents device types
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Description

I have an application that would like the main pages to be served pre-rendered. 
Today I have already built the solution for SSR with renderMode: Server, where the rendering obtains the device type through the UserAgent and creates the HTML/CSS in the format appropriate to what the user is expecting (mobile/tablet/desktop). 
However, the performance result is still poor and I would like to try using renderMode: prerender.
I tried a prerender solution (logically at build time) using getPrerenderParams() that would generate 3 subdirectories for each route and that would be served by special treatment in server.ts, using the subdirectory according to the device type obtained from the user's call. 
The problem is that in the build process, when the prerender is done, the service that defines the deviceType was unable to receive the prerender parameter (generated as a parameter in getPrerenderParams()), noting that the device type is not part of any of the routes. 
If anyone can suggest a solution, I would be grateful.

### Describe the solution you'd like

I suggest creating three features:
1) A solution that allows pre-rendering in a responsive way and that is automatically served according to the user's request on the device, in a simplified way.
2) Make pre-rendering available in an individualized process, separate from build.
3) The pre-rendering process is performed only for specific routes, for example, only for routes of new or changed products.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular v19 - responsive prerendering for differents device types" (#30345)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/build): exclude only source test files with unit-test vitest support
Issues.Body:
When using the experimental `unit-test` builder with the `vitest` runner and code coverage, the automatic coverage excludes are now adjust to not include the bundled test files. This previously prevent accurate coverage analysis. Vite does this as a convenience but is problematic for the bundling strategy employed by the builder's test setup. To workaround this, the excludes are adjusted here to only automatically exclude the TypeScript source test files.

Closes #30333
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/build): exclude only source test files with unit-test vitest support" (#30343)

Issues.Title: CLI command to create AI prompt guide markdown for Copilot, Cursor, and others
Issues.Body:
### Command

generate

### Description

As AI coding assistants (such as GitHub Copilot, Cursor, etc.) become more common in development workflows, many teams want to include AI prompt guide/rules markdown files in their Angular projects. However, each assistant expects these files in different locations and formats (e.g., .github/COPILOT_GUIDE.md for Copilot, .cursor/rules.md for Cursor).

Currently, adding these files is a manual process and can be inconsistent across teams and projects.

Feature Request:
Add a schematic or CLI command that allows users to generate an AI prompt guide markdown file in the correct location and format for their chosen assistant. For example:

Code
ng generate prompt-guide --assistant copilot      # Generates .github/COPILOT_GUIDE.md
ng generate prompt-guide --assistant cursor       # Generates .cursor/rules.md
ng generate prompt-guide --assistant generic      # Generates PROMPT_GUIDE.md in project root

This would:
Help teams adopt AI assistant best practices quickly.
Ensure prompt guides are in the correct and expected locations.
Allow easy expansion as new assistants and conventions emerge.
Keep Angular projects clean by not including these files by default.

### Describe the solution you'd like

_No response_

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### [`v20.0.0-rc.2`](https://redirect.github.com/angular/angular/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#2000-rc2-2025-05-21)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/angular/angular/compare/20.0.0-rc.1...20.0.0-rc.2)

#### Deprecations

##### platform-browser

-   All entries of the `@angular/platform-browser-dynamic`

#### Breaking Changes

##### core

-   `Resource.value()` now returns a default value when in a loading state after reloading the error state
-   `Resource.value()` now throws an error when it's in an error state. Previously it returned `undefined`.
-   `Resource.error` now has a type of `Signal<Error | undefined>` instead of `Signal<unknown>`
-   `Resource.reload` has been moved to `WritableResource.reload`.

Issues.Title: bug(cdkMenu): cdkMenu keyboard navigation loses focus on disabled items and does not follow ARIA guidance
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using cdkMenu, applying cdkMenuItemDisabled to a cdkMenuItem not only sets aria-disabled="true" but also makes the item unfocusable. This behavior contradicts the [WAI-ARIA Menu Bar Pattern](https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/patterns/menubar/), which states:

“Disabled menu items are focusable but cannot be activated.”

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/jqrnmquv-iuz6s9rv?file=src%2Fexample%2Fcdk-menu-standalone-menu-example.html
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open menu
2. Press down arrow key - "Refresh" menu item is selected
3. Press down arrow key again - "Help" menu item is selected and "Settings" is skipped because it is disabled
4. Press up arrow key - "Refresh" menu item is selected, skipping "Settings" again

### Expected Behavior

cdkMenuItems with cdkMenuItemDisabled should remain focusable via keyboard navigation, even though they cannot be activated, in accordance with the WAI-ARIA Menu Bar Pattern.

### Actual Behavior

cdkMenuItems with cdkMenuItemDisabled are skipped entirely during keyboard navigation and are not focusable

### Environment

- Angular: ^19.2.0
- CDK/Material: ^19.2.0
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdkMenu): cdkMenu keyboard navigation loses focus on disabled items and does not follow ARIA guidance" (#31179)

Issues.Title: bug(typography): body-medium and body-small line heights are not accessible
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

To meet criterion 1.4.12 of WCAG 2.1 https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/text-spacing.html body-medium and body-small type should have higher line heights

Current body-medium line height: 20px
Accessible body-medium line height for the same font size: 22px

Current body-small line height: 16px
Accessible body-small line height for the same font size: 18px

### Expected Behavior

Accessible line heights for default typography

### Actual Behavior

Inaccessible line heights for body-medium and body-small typography

### Environment

- Angular: 18
- Material: 3
- Browser(s): Any
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Any
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(typography): body-medium and body-small line heights are not accessible" (#31176)

Issues.Title: refactor: switch m2 surface colors to system terms
Issues.Body:
First phase of using system terminology in m2 that matches M3 instead of the invented foreground/background hardcoded palette colors

- `theme.background.card` => `theme.system.surface`
- `theme.background.dialog` => `theme.system.surface`
- `theme.foreground.text` => `theme.system.on-surface`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: switch m2 surface colors to system terms" (#31175)

Issues.Title: fix(material/radio): assistive technology announcing button as invalid
Issues.Body:
Fixes that some screen readers were reading out "required, invalid data" for radio buttons that were marked as required. The problem was triggered by us using the `required` attribute and the fix is to add `aria-invalid="false"` to it.

Note that an alternate approach is to use `aria-required` instead, but there are some internal checks that require both `aria-required` and `required` to be set which re-introduces the issue.

Fixes #30761.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/radio): assistive technology announcing button as invalid" (#31160)

Issues.Title: build: update dependency firebase-tools to v14
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [firebase-tools](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools) | devDependencies | major | [`^9.2.1` -> `^14.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/firebase-tools/9.23.3/14.4.0) |
| [firebase-tools](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools) | devDependencies | major | [`^11.0.1` -> `^14.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/firebase-tools/11.30.0/14.4.0) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>firebase/firebase-tools (firebase-tools)</summary>

### [`v14.4.0`](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/releases/tag/v14.4.0)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/compare/v14.3.1...v14.4.0)

-   Updated supported runtimes for functions. Default python runtime is now 3.13. ([#​8534](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8534))
-   Fixed issue where Secret Manager API was not automatically enabled for functions using secrets. ([#​8528](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8528))
-   Changed artifact registry cleanup policy error to warn for CI/CD workloads [#​8513](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8513)
-   Enhance firebase init apphosting to support local source deploys. ([#​8479](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8479))
-   Fixed issue where `firebase init hosting:github` didn't correctly parse the repo input. ([#​8536](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8536))
-   Add GCP API client functions to support App Hosting deploy from source feature. ([#​8545](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8545))
-   Fixed an issue where Extensions, Cloud Functions, and App Hosting would run into issues on projects where the default compute service account was changed.
-   Changed firebase init template for functions to pin runtime version on init. ([#​8553](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8553))
-   Fix an issue where updating a Cloud Function that retires would add incorrect fields to the updateMask. ([#​8560](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8560))
-   Fixed multi tenancy support for SSO users in the auth emulator ([#​8544](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8544))
-   Add SDK autoinit capabilities to App Hosting emulator. ([#​8582](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8582))
-   Provision App Hosting compute service account during init flow. ([#​8580](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8580))
-   Updated the Firebase Data Connect local toolkit to v2.6.1, which includes the following changes: ([#​8598](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8598))
    -   Fixed a bug where `@transaction` continued to execute after errors and produces more confusing errors.
    -   Fixed a bug where rolled-back fields in `@transaction` returned bogus data that had been invalidated by the rollback. They now correctly return null with a corresponding error "(rolled back)".
    -   Disallow `@check` on side-effect fields if the mutation doesn't have `@transaction`.
    -   Improved error messages when reading a field of `null` in CEL expressions.
    -   Updated the underlying Go dependency version from v1.22.2 to v1.22.12.
    -   Added the `response` binding to Server Values and `@check(expr:)` CEL expressions.

### [`v14.3.1`](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/releases/tag/v14.3.1)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/compare/v14.3.0...v14.3.1)

-   Fixed issue where `firebase init firestore` would raise an error due to rules/indexes file path being undefined. ([#​8518](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8518))
-   Fixed an issue where `firebase use` required `serviceusage.viewer` permissions. ([#​8519](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8519))

### [`v14.3.0`](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/releases/tag/v14.3.0)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/compare/v14.2.2...v14.3.0)

-   Fixed an issue where the prompt to create apphosting.emulator.yaml did not work with backends that are not at the project.root ([#​8412](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8412))
-   Fixed an issue where Terms of Service acceptance would be checked for non-human users.
-   Fixed an issue where Cloud Resource Manager was called without checking whether it is enabled on the user's project.
-   Updated the Firebase Data Connect local toolkit to v2.5.0, which includes the following changes: ([#​8514](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8514))
    -   Fixed an issue where some server value expression errors incorrectly abort mutation execution.
    -   Added README generation to Angular codegen, which explains how to use generated query and mutation injector functions.
-   Updated emulator UI to v1.15.0, which fixes some issues when running on Firebase Studio.

### [`v14.2.2`](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/releases/tag/v14.2.2)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/compare/v14.2.1...v14.2.2)

-   Cleaned up prompt for setting up web frameworks during `init dataconnect`.
-   Fixed an issue were the Emualtor suite would check for auth when using `demo-` projects.
-   Updated the Firebase Data Connect local toolkit to v2.4.0, which adds support for `add` and `remove` list update transforms and fixes an issue where updating a column to `null` was ignored. ([#​8484](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8484))

### [`v14.2.1`](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/releases/tag/v14.2.1)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/compare/v14.2.0...v14.2.1)

-   Fixed version for init genkit. Previously it was looking for the version of the old package 'genkit' instead of th new 'genkit-cli'.
-   Updated the Firebase Data Connect local toolkit to v2.3.1, which contains the following changes: ([#​8455](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8455))
    -   Added support for `inc` and `dec` update transforms for `Date` and `Timestamp` scalars.
    -   Fixed a bug where `OR` and `AND` clauses may be evaluated in the incorrect order.
    -   Fixed an issue where `{includes: $var}` or `{includesAll: [$var]}` clauses should be dropped if `$var` is missing.

### [`v14.2.0`](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/releases/tag/v14.2.0)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/compare/v14.1.0...v14.2.0)

-   Fixed an issue in the extensions emulator where parameter default values would not be substitued into resource definitions.
-   Keep artifact registry dry run off for policy changes ([#​8419](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8419))
-   Allowed users to create paid Cloud SQL instances for Data Connect when the free trial has already been used.
-   Updated the Firebase Data Connect local toolkit to v2.2.0, which contains the following changes: ([#​8434](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8434))
    -   Added support for aggregate functions on singular fields.
    -   Added the ability to get an operation name without calling the `ref` function in generated web SDK.
    -   Properly enforced one-of validation on `inc`, `dec`, `append`, and `prepend` update transforms. Existing deployed connectors that violate this constraint will still work, but will need to be fixed to use list syntax before being re-deployed.
    -   Fixed an issue so that when using mutations with no variables, correct types are passed in.

### [`v14.1.0`](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/releases/tag/v14.1.0)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/compare/v14.0.1...v14.1.0)

-   Fixed an issue where the Extensions emulator did not provide fall back values for v2 Firestore event triggers. ([#​8390](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8390))
-   Fixed issue with prompt when Data Connect prompts user for framework generation.
-   Fixed a bug where the Admin SDK fails with ENOTFOUND when automatically connecting to the Data Connect emulator when run in the Functions emulator. ([#​8379](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8379))
-   Updated the Firebase Data Connect local toolkit to v2.1.0 which includes the following changes: ([#​8400](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8400))
    -   Added support for update transforms.
    -   Added support for server value expressions for Int, Float, String, Date, Timestamp, and UUID data types.
    -   Fixed an issue where CommonJS modules don't reference ref functions properly.

### [`v14.0.1`](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/releases/tag/v14.0.1)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/compare/v14.0.0...v14.0.1)

-   Fixed a bug where the Admin SDK would not automatically connect to the Data Connect emulator when run in the Functions emulator. ([#​8379](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8379))
-   Fix Cloud Functions deployment failure when service account is null. ([#​8381](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8381))

### [`v14.0.0`](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/releases/tag/v14.0.0)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/compare/v13.35.1...v14.0.0)

-   BREAKING(general)! Removed support for node 18.
-   BREAKING(apphosting)! `init emulators` App Hosting flow now creates `apphosting.emulator.yaml` with references to live secrets rather than `apphosting.local.yaml` with saved plaintext. `apphosting:config:export` command has been removed ([#​8361](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8361))
-   BREAKING(apphosting)! Removed `--location` flag from `apphosting` commands. Instead, commands now prompt for primary region as needed.
-   BREAKING(dataconnect)! `deploy dataconnect` now warns about unsafe connector changes and insecure operations.
-   BREAKING(cloud functions)! Removed the `experimental:functions:shell` command. Use `functions:shell` instead.
-   Updated the Firebase Data Connect local toolkit to v2.0.0, which contains the following changes: ([#​8370](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8370))
    -   Added support for aggregate functions in queries.
    -   BREAKING: New types for Generated React SDKs.
    -   Improved description of various auto-generated mutation fields.
    -   Fixed an issue where pnpm users' SDKs aren't linked properly.
-   `apphosting:secrets:grantAccess` can now grant access to emails and can grant multiple secrets at once ([#​8357](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8357))
-   `apphosting:secrets:set` now has flows to help with test secrets ([#​8359](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8359))
-   Updated `init dataconnect` templates to `v1`.
-   Fixed a bug where the emulator suite would set `FIREBASE_DATACONNECT_EMULATOR_HOST` instead of `FIREBASE_DATA_CONNECT_EMULATOR_HOST`.
-   Fixed a bug in Auth emulator where accounts:lookup is case-sensitive for emails ([#​8344](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8344))
-   Fixed a bug where function deploys didn't support shorthand notation and parameterized service account ([#​8366](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8366))
-   Fixed an issue where `sql:setup` would incorrectly remove the `cloudsqlsuperuser` role from `firebasesuperuser` ([#​8363](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8363))
-   Fixed a bug where `appdistribution:testers:list` would error out if there were no testers.
-   Fixed a bug where Vertex AI API would not be automatically enabled when emulating Data Connect services that use it.

### [`v13.35.1`](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/releases/tag/v13.35.1)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/compare/v13.35.0...v13.35.1)

-   Fix bug where functions:artifacts:setpolicy command's --none option didn't work as expected ([#​8330](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8330))

### [`v13.35.0`](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/releases/tag/v13.35.0)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/compare/v13.34.0...v13.35.0)

-   Added support for generated Angular SDKs for Data Connect
-   App Hosting emulator can now load secret env vars. ([#​8305](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8305))
-   Fixed webframeworks deployments when using multiple hosting sites in `firebase.json`. ([#​8314](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8314))
-   Added a new command to setup a cleanup policy for functions artifacts. ([#​8268](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8268))
-   Added support for 3rd party builders for Angular. ([#​7557](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/7557))
-   Fixed GCF V2 artifact cleanup by correctly encoding artifact names to match GCF V2's format. ([#​8318](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8318))
-   Increase emulator UI body parser limit to match Storage emulator maximum. ([#​8329](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8329))
-   Fixed Data Connect setup issues for fresh databases due to IAM user not being created. ([#​8335](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8335))
-   Fixed an issue where `ext:install` used POSIX file seperators on Windows machines. ([#​8326](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8326))
-   Updated the Firebase Data Connect local toolkit to v1.9.2, which adds support for generated Angular SDKs and updates Dart SDK fields to follow best practices. ([#​8347](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8347))

### [`v5.0.0`](https://redirect.github.com/chalk/chalk/releases/tag/v5.0.0)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/chalk/chalk/compare/v4.1.2...v5.0.0)

##### Breaking

-   **This package is now pure ESM. Please [read this](https://gist.github.com/sindresorhus/a39789f98801d908bbc7ff3ecc99d99c).**
    -   If you use TypeScript, you need to use TypeScript 4.7 or later. [Why.](https://redirect.github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/46452)
    -   If you use a bundler, make sure it supports ESM and that you have correctly configured it for ESM.
    -   The Chalk issue tracker is not a support channel for your favorite build/bundler tool.
    -   It's totally fine to stay on Chalk v4. It's been stable for years.
-   Require Node.js 12.20  [`fa16f4e`](https://redirect.github.com/chalk/chalk/commit/fa16f4e)
-   Move some properties off the default export to individual named exports:
    -   `chalk.Instance` → `Chalk`
    -   `chalk.supportsColor` → `supportsColor`
    -   `chalk.stderr` → `chalkStderr`
    -   `chalk.stderr.supportsColor` → `supportsColorStderr`
-   Remove `.keyword()`, `.hsl()`, `.hsv()`, `.hwb()`, and `.ansi()` coloring methods ([#​433](https://redirect.github.com/chalk/chalk/issues/433))  [`4cf2e40`](https://redirect.github.com/chalk/chalk/commit/4cf2e40)
    -   These were not commonly used and added a lot of bloat to Chalk. You can achieve the same by using the [`color-convert` package](https://redirect.github.com/Qix-/color-convert).
-   The tagged template literal support moved into a separate package: [`chalk-template`](https://redirect.github.com/chalk/chalk-template) ([#​524](https://redirect.github.com/chalk/chalk/issues/524))  [`c987c61`](https://redirect.github.com/chalk/chalk/commit/c987c61)

```diff
-import chalk from 'chalk';
+import chalkTemplate from 'chalk-template';

-chalk`2 + 3 = {bold ${2 + 3}}`;
+chalkTemplate`2 + 3 = {bold ${2 + 3}}`;
```

##### Improvements

-   Bundle dependencies  [`04fdbd6`](https://redirect.github.com/chalk/chalk/commit/04fdbd6)
    -   This means Chalk no longer has any dependencies 🎉
-   [The install size is less than half of v4.](https://packagephobia.com/result?p=chalk)
-   Add `overline` style  ([#​433](https://redirect.github.com/chalk/chalk/issues/433))  [`4cf2e40`](https://redirect.github.com/chalk/chalk/commit/4cf2e40)
-   Preserve function prototype methods ([#​434](https://redirect.github.com/chalk/chalk/issues/434))  [`0fba91b`](https://redirect.github.com/chalk/chalk/commit/0fba91b)

</details>

Issues.Title: fix(material/radio): required attribute being set on buttons
Issues.Body:
fixes when `MatRadioGroup` is set to be required it was setting all of its `MatRadioButton` to be required as-well which is confusing for assistive technologies, this commit ensures we only set aria-required on group rather than all buttons unless button is being used standalone of `MatRadioGroup`

fixes #30399

Issues.Body:

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Well I had to migrate a large codebase from some old version of angular to angular 19. Little I did know I was about to open the doors of the hell. I spent 1 f. day to understand how to migrate. "oh you need to just import modules on components that's all" yes, sure. After a while a give up and created a new project, added angular material, disabled ssr, added a simple material slider and ran the application. Always the same f. issue: on desktop everything works perfectly, but when I access the angular app on mobile nothing works. When I go to chrome://inspect it says something like "this configuration requires zone.js". So I import it in the main.ts file but nohting changes. It's so disappointing. I used to love angular but I think I need to change framework at this point. Not even gpt o3 could understand what was wrong jesus
